titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 860: Collection of documents concerning inheritance

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger; attribution from Zacour-Hirsch.
Incipit (1st document): In nomine Domini Amen. Cum nil sit certius morte nil vero incertius hora ipsius quae in animo cuius libet...
Notarial signatures, but no signets, follow most of the documents.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Copies of the will of Domina Georgeta, daughter of Marco Centurioni and widow of Jeronimo Cattanei, and legal proceedings about the inheritance, involving primarily her grandson Silvester Cattanei and Isoltina, his brother Jeronimo's widow, dated 1548-1549, notarized by various officials of Genoa, with some earlier documents interspersed (Zacour-Hirsch).

supportDesc.extent: 46 leaves : 205 x 149 (174 x 118) mm. bound to 210 x 152 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, i (contemporary paper) + 46 + i (contemporary paper); [1-46]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in several cancellaresca and notarial hands.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Giuseppe Martini (Kraus' description) and Silvester Cattaneus (inscription, front flyleaf i recto).
Sold by H. P. Kraus (Cat. 189, no. 41), April 1958.
